selected_quotes: Stop referring to famine as a natural event - it's almost always man made
History throws up countless examples of food being used as an instrument of power
‘Creating a famine’ should be an offence under international law
Famine doesn't just 'happen' - those who cause it must be held to account. Important piece
don't people realize that in an era of #contraception #foodscarcity may be lessened by #familyplanning -

citation.abstract: International law should include an offence of 'creating a famine'.
citation.title: Famine doesn't just 'happen' – and those who cause it must be held to account

news.title: Famine doesn't just 'happen' – and those who cause it must be held to account
news.summary: The relationship between food insecurity and conflict is almost so logical that it appears to state the obvious: conditions of food insecurity contribute to the outbreak of social, political and military conflict, which in turn produces further food…

news.title: Famine isn't just a result of conflict—it's a cause
news.summary: This article was originally published on The Conversation. Read the original article.

facebook.title: Famine doesn't just 'happen' – and those who cause it must be held to account
facebook.summary: Stop referring to famine as a natural event – it's almost always man made.

facebook.title: Famine doesn't just 'happen' – and those who cause it must be held to account
facebook.summary: When media describes famine, i.e. in #SouthSudan, as almost sudden, disastrous events created by the forces of nature, we are likely to fail to understand that famine is rather the result of a 'dynamic social and political process with a long build-up.'

facebook.title: Famine doesn't just 'happen' – and those who cause it must be held to account
facebook.summary: International law should include an offence of 'creating a famine'.
